summary: The English Language Unity Act of 2025 aims to declare English as the official language of the United States. It amends Title 4 of the U.S. Code to establish this designation and outlines the obligations of the federal government in preserving and promoting English. The bill also establishes a uniform English language rule for naturalization, mandates that naturalization ceremonies be conducted in English, and provides general rules for construing the English language texts of U.S. laws. It directs the Secretary of Homeland Security to issue a proposed rule for uniform English language testing for naturalization candidates.
